shorts.content: CARBONDALE, PA, November 13, 2025 — The Defense Logistics Agency (DLA) has exercised the third one-year option period of the Advanced Combat Helmet Generation II (ACH Gen II) production contract (SPE1C1-23-D-0004) awarded to Gentex Corporation. Valued at up t…

shorts.title: HS ROUNDUP: Dallas girls rally past Scranton, Bucciarelli wins No. 700
shorts.title_distilled: HS ROUNDUP: Dallas girls rally past Scranton, Bucciarelli wins No.
shorts.description: Molly Walsh scored 17 points and Dallas rallied in the fourth quarter to slip past Scranton, 54-53, in a nonleague girls basketball matchup Friday and give coach Vince Bucciarelli his milestone 700th career victory. Bucciarelli is in his fourth season at Dallas. He also spent 32 years at Abington Heights and six at Mid Valley, coaching 1,076 career games. Dallas trailed, 46-38, after three quarters. But Riley Samanas scored five points in the fourth quarter and Walsh had four to fuel the Lady Mountaineers’ comeback. Mia DelGaudio added 10 points for the Lady Mountaineers. It was the second one-point victory […]
shorts.content: Molly Walsh scored 17 points and Dallas rallied in the fourth quarter to slip past Scranton, 54-53, in a nonleague girls basketball matchup Friday and give coach Vince Bucciarelli his milestone 700th career victory. Bucciarelli is in his fourth season at Dallas. He also spent 32 years at Abington Heights and six at Mid Valley, coaching 1,076 career games. Dallas trailed, 46-38, after three quarters. But Riley Samanas scored five points in the fourth quarter and Walsh had four to fuel the Lady Mountaineers’ comeback. Mia DelGaudio added 10 points for the Lady Mountaineers. It was the second one-point victory […]
shorts.content_distilled: Molly Walsh scored 17 points and Dallas rallied in the fourth quarter to slip past Scranton, 54-53, in a nonleague girls basketball matchup Friday and give coach Vince Bucciarelli his milestone 700th career victory.

shorts.title: Dalton Lions Club donation to Janet Weis Children’s Hospital
shorts.title_distilled: Dalton Lions Club donation to Janet Weis Children’s Hospital.
shorts.description: The Dalton Lions Club donated $5,000 to the Janet Weis Children’s Hospital during its August meeting at the Scranton Canoe Club. At left is Lions Club member Jay Robbins presenting the check to Glenn Bernius, system director, Geisinger Health Foundation.
shorts.content: The Dalton Lions Club donated $5,000 to the Janet Weis Children’s Hospital during its August meeting at the Scranton Canoe Club. At left is Lions Club member Jay Robbins presenting the check to Glenn Bernius, system director, Geisinger Health Foundation.
shorts.content_distilled: Dalton Lions Club donated $5,000 to the Janet Weis Children’s Hospital during its August meeting at the Scranton Canoe Club.

shorts.title: LHVA to build $2M bridge, walking trail connecting Olyphant to Dickson City
shorts.title_distilled: LHVA to build $2M bridge, walking trail connecting Olyphant to Dickson City.
shorts.description: Lackawanna Heritage Valley Authority to construct a pedestrian bridge over the Lackawanna River that will link an upcoming section of the Heritage Trail in Olyphant with an existing section in Dickson City

shorts.title: NEPMTA presents music scholarships
shorts.description: The NE Pa. Music Teachers Association (NEPMTA), in conjunction with the “NEPA’s Got Talent” show, recently presented music scholarships to three high school seniors who will continue their music studies in college. From left: Grace Campbell, a piano student of NEPMTA member Roxanne Condell, a music major in the fall at Marywood University; Pamela Carroll, NEPMTA member accepting the scholarship for her piano student Blake Seiwell, who will enter the U.S. Marine Corps and has been accepted into the Marine Corps Band; and Andrea Bogusko, president of NEPMTA, accepting the scholarship for Devon Winters, entering Penn State University, Main Campus, […]
shorts.content: The NE Pa. Music Teachers Association (NEPMTA), in conjunction with the “NEPA’s Got Talent” show, recently presented music scholarships to three high school seniors who will continue their music studies in college. shorts.title: Clipboard, December 6, 2025
shorts.description: Lackawanna County Annual cut-a-thon: Women’s Resource Center’s 34th annual Santa’s Snippers Walk-In Cut-A-Thon, Sunday, 10 a.m.-2 p.m. (last walk-ins at 1 p.m.), Career Technology Center of Lackawanna County, 3201 Rockville Ave., Scranton; haircuts for $15. Enjoy free photos with special guests, Santa and Mrs. Claus, thanks to the support of professional designers of Chippy White Table. Proceeds go directly to support WRC’s mission to provide critical resources for survivors of domestic violence and sexual assault. Mayfield Food sale: St. John’s Russian Orthodox Cathedral homemade bread, kolachi and cookie sale for the holidays, Dec. 23, 10 a.m.-6 p.m., St. John’s Center, […]
